remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化期间，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构会动态生成和编译派生自的反序列化的临时类 。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that is derived from . 在此过程中，基础结构将生成 方法，并创建 用于存储修复方法及其输入数据的对象。During this process, the infrastructure generates methods and it creates objects to store the fix-up methods and their input data. 基础结构针对 SOAP 编码的数组或 SOAP 编码的多引用元素执行此操作，这些元素的数据类型（在任一情况下）映射到 .NET Framework 集合或枚举。The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays or SOAP-encoded, multi-referenced elements whose data types, in either case, map to .NET Framework collections or enumerations. 接下来，根据需要，在反序列化过程中调用方法，以填充数组项或多引用对象。Next, as necessary, the methods are invoked during deserialization to fill in array items or multi-referenced objects. 不应直接创建 或类的实例 。You should not directly create an instance of the or class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在将 XML 文档反序列化为 .NET Framework 对象时，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构会动态创建修复方法的实例，这些方法实现 委托并创建类的实例 来存储修复方法及其输入数据。While deserializing XML documents into .NET Framework objects, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically creates instances of fix-up methods that implement the delegate and creates instances of the class to store the fix-up methods and their input data. 基础结构为其数据类型映射到 .NET Framework 引用类型的 SOAP 编码数组执行此操作。The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays whose data types map to .NET Framework reference types. 接下来，如有必要，将调用一个修复方法来填充数组中的对象。Next, as necessary, a fix-up method is called to fill in the objects in the array. 此外，在初始化期间，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构会动态生成和编译派生自的反序列化的临时类 。In addition, during initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that derives from . 在此过程中，基础结构将 为 SOAP 编码的多引用 XML 数据生成方法和对象。During this process, the infrastructure generates methods and objects for SOAP-encoded, multi-referenced XML data. 然后，在反序列化过程中调用方法。The methods are then invoked during deserialization. 不应直接创建或类的实例 。You should not directly create instances of the or classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 编码允许唯一 XML 元素在 SOAP 消息内作为 `multiRef` 由特性标识的元素出现一次 `id` 。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`可以通过属性 (中的属性多次引用该值， `ref` 或 `href` 在替代元素中) SOAP 1.1 中的属性。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times by `ref` attributes (or `href` attributes in SOAP 1.1) in substitute elements. Soap 编码在 SOAP 1.1 规范的第5节中进行了介绍。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. Soap 编码（如 SOAP 1.1 规范的第5节中所指定）允许在 SOAP 消息中多次引用元素 (或者（可选），只需) `href` 主消息中的属性引用。SOAP encoding, as specified in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification, allows for elements referenced multiple times in a SOAP message (or optionally, just once) to be referred by an `href` attribute in the main message. 当这样的元素出现时，就会发生事件，但没有对 `href` 它的引用。An event occurs when such an element appears, but there is no `href` reference to it. 将处理程序方法添加到 ，以便在执行未引用对象的方法时为其提供自定义处理 。Add a handler method to to provide custom handling for unreferenced objects while the executes its method.
